docblock.description: Base Hooks handling class. Hooks can be used to run scripts prior to loading the form, or after a form has been submitted.
docblock.long-description: Hooks can be either a predefined list by FormIt, or custom MODX Snippets. They can also be chained to allow for order-of-execution processing. Returning false from a Hook will end the chain. Returning false in a postHook will prevent the form from being further submitted.

docblock.description: A collection of all the processed errors so far.
A collection of all the processed hooks so far.
A reference to the modX instance.
A reference to the FormIt instance.
If a hook redirects, it needs to set this var to use proper order of execution on redirects/stores
The current stored and parsed fields for the FormIt call.
The constructor for the fiHooks class

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$formit A reference to the FormIt class instance.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. An array of configuration parameters.

docblock.description: Loads an array of hooks. If one fails, will not proceed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hooks to run.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The fields and values of the form

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of extra properties to send to the hook

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of field name => value pairs.

tag.description: The fields and values of the form.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Any other custom properties to load into a custom hook.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if hook was successful.

docblock.description: Redirect to a specified URL.
docblock.long-description: Properties needed: - redirectTo - the ID of the Resource to redirect to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of cleaned POST fields

tag.name: return
tag.description: False if unsuccessful.

docblock.description: Send an email of the form.
docblock.long-description: Properties: - emailTpl - The chunk name of the chunk that will be the email template. This will send the values of the form as placeholders. - emailTo - A comma separated list of email addresses to send to - emailToName - A comma separated list of names to pair with addresses. - emailFrom - The From: email address. Defaults to either the email field or the emailsender setting. - emailFromName - The name of the From: user. - emailSubject - The subject of the email. - emailHtml - Boolean, if true, email will be in HTML mode.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of cleaned POST fields

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if email was successfully sent.

docblock.description: Processes string and sets placeholders

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to process

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of placeholders to replace with values

tag.name: return
tag.description: The parsed string

docblock.description: Ensure the a field passes a spam filter.
docblock.long-description: Properties: - spamEmailFields - The email fields to check. A comma-delimited list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of cleaned POST fields

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if email was successfully sent.

docblock.description: Adds in reCaptcha support to FormIt

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of cleaned POST fields

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if email was successfully sent.

docblock.description: Handles custom validation on fields. Allows for specific, defined validators by FormIt, or custom Validators that are MODX Snippets.
docblock.long-description: Validation can be chained to do proper order-of-execution for field value checking.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A collection of all the processed errors so far.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A collection of all the non-processed errors so far.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A collection of all the validated fields so far.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A reference to the modX instance.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A reference to the FormIt instance.

docblock.description: The constructor for the fiValidator class

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$formit A reference to the FormIt class instance.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. An array of configuration parameters.

docblock.description: Validates an array of fields. Returns the field names and values, with the field names stripped of their validators.
docblock.long-description:
The key names can be in this format:

name:validator=param:anotherValidator:oneMoreValidator=param

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of field name => value pairs.

docblock.description: Helper method for validating fields
Validates a field based on a custom rule, if specified

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key of the field

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the field

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. The type of the validator to apply. Can either be a method name of fiValidator or a Snippet name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if validation was successful. If not, will store error messages to $this->errors.

docblock.description: Base class for FormIt. Used for initializing the form processing engine, handling templating and running snippets.

A configuration array
In debug mode, will monitor execution time.
True if the class has been initialized or not.
The fiHooks instance for processing preHooks
The fiHooks instance for processing postHooks
The request handling class
An array of cached chunk tpls for processing
Used when running unit tests to prevent emails/headers from being sent

docblock.description: Gets a unique session-based store key for storing form submissions.
Gets a Chunk and caches it; also falls back to file-based templates for easier debugging.
docblock.long-description: Will always use the file-based chunk if $debug is set to true.

tag.description: The name of the Chunk

tag.name: param
tag.description: The properties for the Chunk

tag.name: return

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the Chunk. Will parse to name.chunk.tpl

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the modChunk object if found, otherwise false.

docblock.description: Output the final output and wrap in the wrapper chunk. Optional, but recommended for debugging as it outputs the execution time to the output.
docblock.long-description: Also, it is good to output your snippet code with wrappers for easier CSS isolation and styling.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The output to process

tag.name: return
tag.description: The final wrapped output

docblock.description: Starts the debug timer.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The start time.

docblock.description: Ends the debug timer and returns the total number of seconds script took to run.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The end total time to execute the script.
